fields.label: How much pain in your shoulder do you have during your usual daily activities?

Can you wash your back / fasten your bra?

Can you comb / wash your hair?

Can you lift 4 kilograms above the level of your shoulder?

fields.label: ACJ instability type Rockwood
fields.note: Rockwood Type I - Sprain of AC ligaments without joint instability. Type II - AC ligament rupture with partial coracoclavicular (CC) ligament sprain, causing mild instability. Type III - Complete AC and CC ligament rupture, leading to clavicular elevation and moderate instability. Type IV - Clavicle displaced posteriorly into the trapezius, due to severe ligamentous disruption. Type V - Severe superior displacement of the clavicle (>100% increase in CC distance), indicating extensive soft tissue injury. Type VI - Inferior displacement of the clavicle under the coracoid, an extremely rare injury due to high-energy trauma.
